The Ides Of April
The presence of forces with obvious malintent towards the West in Vietnam and generally in South-East
Asia, and imminence of a real and escalating confrontation has created a concern for the country's future from
every quarter of social awareness. It is safe to say that
the students have emerged in some respect, the most
effective of the public forces.
Marchers, singers, petitioners, and most notably,
fasters stand out for their institutionalized grief, and
though a bit removed from the more functional feeders,
have certainly exhibited more compassion than other
identifiable groups.
In publically denouncing government policy, in
questioning the reliability of press reports, in standing
for a broad doctrine under which the Vietnam crisis
has a specific interpretation, and finally in proposing
an alternative suggestions, the students emerge not only
